treatment.description: Leaves apiculate; costa percurrent to excurrent; adaxial distal laminal cells mammillose, smooth on both surfaces.
treatment.phenology: Capsules mature winter (late Dec, Feb) to spring.
treatment.habitat: Shaded or exposed moist limestone, quarries, brick mortar, stream banks;
treatment.discussion: The citation for Georgia by H. A. Crum and L. E. Anderson (1981) may have been based on a specimen here redetermined as Hyophila involuta (Anderson & Crum 13658, CANM, DUKE).
